column4: hello, i've installed version of Ubuntu 7.10 and i want to upgrade to Jaunty 9 from the CD
that is not a very good idea.
you should upgrade from 7.10>8.04>8.10>9.04 , and it would be easier on the network (although i concede pretty heavy on bandwidth usage)
what about the desk space required to do all these upgrades
a direct upgrade from 7.10 > 9.04 can be tortorous
should not be much. i'd keep about a GB of free space or so
you should do an apt-cache clean occasionally to free up some space if you have a disk size problem
so if i've 2G, i can apply all upgrades!..  apt-cache clean  #-> invalid operation clean
my apologies. it was apt-get clean
ultimately depends on how many applications you have, but i would be surprised if you need more than 1g per upgrade
